Package ohos.distributedschedule.scenario

Class ScenarioInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.distributedschedule.scenario.ScenarioInfo

  • public final class ScenarioInfo
extends Object
    Provides information about a distributed scenario, including the scenario type, migration direction, and application bundle name.

    You can call:

    • setScenarioType(int) to set the scenario type for a distributed scenario.
    • setDirection(boolean) to set the migration direction (either out-migration or in-migration) for a distributed scenario.
    • setBundleName(java.lang.String) to specify the bundle name.
    Since:
    3

      Constructor Description

      Default constructor used to create an empty ScenarioInfo instance.
      ScenarioInfo​(int scenarioType, boolean direction, String bundleName)
      A constructor used to create a ScenarioInfo instance with the specified scenarioType, direction, and bundleName.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScenarioInfo

        public ScenarioInfo​()
        Default constructor used to create an empty ScenarioInfo instance.
        Since:
        3

      • ScenarioInfo

        public ScenarioInfo​(int scenarioType,
                    boolean direction,
                    String bundleName)
        A constructor used to create a ScenarioInfo instance with the specified scenarioType, direction, and bundleName.
        Parameters:
        scenarioType - Indicates the distributed scenario type, which is defined in ScenarioConstant. Currently, only ScenarioConstant#SCENARIO_TYPE_NAVIGATION_CONTINUE is supported.
        direction - Indicates the migration direction, either true for out-migration, or false for in-migration.
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the application your application wants to monitor in the specific scenario.
        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • setScenarioType

        public void setScenarioType​(int scenarioType)
        Sets the scenario type for this ScenarioInfo object.
        Parameters:
        scenarioType - Indicates the distributed scenario type, which is defined in ScenarioConstant. Currently, only ScenarioConstant#SCENARIO_TYPE_NAVIGATION_CONTINUE is supported.
        Since:
        3

      • getScenarioType

        public int getScenarioType​()
        Obtains the scenario type of this ScenarioInfo object. The scenario type is set by calling setScenarioType(int).
        Returns:
        Returns the scenario type.
        Since:
        3

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(boolean direction)
        Sets whether the migration direction of this ScenarioInfo object is out-migration or in-migration.

        The out-migration direction indicates that the application can initiate remote calls; and the in-migration direction indicates that the application can be remotely called by other devices in the distributed system.

        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the migration direction, either true for out-migration, or false for in-migration.
        Since:
        3

      • getDirection

        public boolean getDirection​()
        Obtains the migration direction of this ScenarioInfo object. The migration direction is set by calling setDirection(boolean).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the direction is out-migration; returns false if it is in-migration.
        Since:
        3

      • setBundleName

        public void setBundleName​(String bundleName)
        Sets the bundle name your application wants to monitor in this ScenarioInfo object.

        Generally, applications want to monitor their own status changes in distributed scenarios. If your application is not authorized to access the specified bundle name, the access will be rejected.

        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name to set.
        Since:
        3

      • getBundleName

        public String getBundleName​()
        Obtains the bundle name of the application being monitored in this ScenarioInfo object. The bundle name is set by calling setBundleName(java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        Returns the bundle name.
        Since:
        3
